intro: Machaeranthera canescens var. commixta, commonly known as the Texas tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and gray-green foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid environments.
